quiz.question: Brain Teaser: 45yo man post-motorcycle accident presents with loss of pain/temp right body, vibration/proprioception left leg, ipsilateral Horner. Level?
quiz.explanation: Classic Brown-Séquard: ipsilateral motor/proprioception loss (CST/dorsal column), contralateral pain/temp (spinothalamic cross), Horner if cervical.

quiz.question: Brain Teaser: 30yo woman thyroidectomy develops hoarseness, deviates left on swallow. Injury?
quiz.explanation: Left recurrent loops under aortic arch (longer course); unopposed right pulls vocal cord right, deviates tongue/vocal cord left.

quiz.question: Brain Teaser: 60yo smoker coughs blood, CT shows lingular mass invading mediastinum. Collateral damaged?
quiz.explanation: Thoracic duct ascends left posterior mediastinum; lingula (left upper lobe) invasion risks chylothorax.

quiz.question: Brain Teaser: 25yo trauma, expanding flank hematoma, hypotension. Triple injury?
Brain Teaser: 25yo trauma, expanding flank hematoma, hypotension. Triple injury?
quiz.explanation: Gerota fascia rupture allows retroperitoneal spread; duodenum/pancreas share plane with kidney.

quiz.question: Brain Teaser: 50yo alcoholic abdominal pain, pulsatile mass, absent femoral pulses bilateral. AAA complication?
quiz.explanation: AAA erodes IMA; backbleed via collaterals (meandering mesenteric) but thrombosis causes colonic ischemia.

quiz.question: Brain Teaser: Newborn bilateral talipes equinovarus, MRI lumbosacral agenesis. Associated malformation?
quiz.explanation: Caudal regression syndrome/VACTERL: vertebral, anal, cardiac, TE fistula, renal, limb defects.

quiz.question: Brain Teaser: 35yo post-partum leg swelling, sudden dyspnea. Anatomy explains PE source?
quiz.explanation: Pregnancy hypercoagulable + left ovarian vein drains to renal (stasis) + right iliac compression by uterus.

quiz.question: Brain Teaser: Surgeon ligates structure in Hesselbach triangle during hernia repair, patient develops ischemic left testis. What?
quiz.explanation: Direct hernia lateral to inferior epigastric; ligation risks anastomotic supply to testis (ductus deferens a.).

quiz.question: Brain Teaser: 70yo cataract surgery, pupil fixed dilated, ptosis, eye down/out. Syndrome?
quiz.explanation: Post-surgical oculomotor palsy: parasympathetic (pupil), levator (ptosis), SR/MR/IR (down/out).

quiz.question: Brain Teaser: Baseball player pitches, sudden shoulder pain, can't abduct. Test positive?
quiz.explanation: Supraspinatus tear/inflammation; empty can stresses supraspinatus.

quiz.question: Concept: Structure passing through lesser sciatic foramen?
quiz.explanation: Lesser sciatic: obturator internus tendon, nerve to obturator internus, pudendal n./internal pudendal v.

quiz.question: Concept: Blood supply solely from internal carotid artery?
quiz.explanation: Labyrinthine a. (otic branch ICA) sole supply to cochlea; optic from ophthalmic (ICA).

quiz.question: Concept: Lymphatic drainage of lower anal canal?
quiz.explanation: Below dentate line: somatic (below pectinate), drains superficial inguinal nodes.

quiz.question: Concept: Remnant forming median umbilical ligament?
quiz.explanation: Urachus obliterates to median umbilical ligament from bladder apex to umbilicus.

quiz.question: Concept: Muscle pierced by needle for sciatic block?
quiz.explanation: Subgluteal approach: through gluteus maximus to sciatic between ischial tuberosity/greater trochanter.

quiz.question: Concept: Foramen in greater wing sphenoid transmits?
quiz.explanation: Rotundum (V2), ovale (V3), spinosum (middle meningeal).

quiz.question: Concept: Branch of profunda femoris supplying adductor magnus?
quiz.explanation: 4th perforator supplies hamstring portion of adductor magnus.

quiz.question: Concept: Ossification center appears first in which carpal bone?
quiz.explanation: Capitate (birth), hamate (1m), triquetrum (3y), lunate (4y); scaphoid trapezium late.

quiz.question: Concept: Tributary joining left renal vein?
quiz.explanation: Left renal receives gonadal/suprarenal; right direct to IVC (shorter).

quiz.question: Concept: Ligament preventing anterior shoulder dislocation?
quiz.explanation: Inferior glenohumeral primary restraint to anterior/inferior translation.
